titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Wilmer Cave Wright (1865â€“1951) was a reader, lecturer, and professor of Greek at Bryn Mawr College from 1897 to her retirement in 1933. Her doctoral dissertation, entitled The Emperor Julian's relation to the new sophistic and neo-Platonism, was published in 1896. She was also the translator of Bernardino Ramazzini's De morbis artificum (Diseases of workers).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of miscellaneous notes and papers of Wilmer Cave Wright. Included are research materials gathered for her translation of Ramazzini, a partial manuscript of "Recent Theories Concerning the Phoenicians," correspondence, reprints, newspaper clippings on various topics, and a list of volumes in Wright's library. Also included are two volumes on Plato with Wright's annotations.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
